RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Supreme Court: Supreme Court of the United States

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: the highest court in the land that has long held that reasonableness is the touchstone of analysis in determining reasonable suspicion, emphasizing the importance of considering all relevant factors and rejecting the position that a lawful traffic stop may violate the Constitution if the stop was merely a pretext to allow officers to search for contraband, refused to authorize investigative interrogations at law enforcement stations on less than probable cause or consent
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in detecting illegal entry and smuggling, with agents having experience in evaluating circumstances related to reasonable suspicion, also involved in the arrest and questioning of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., location of questioning
